clinical_logic.readiness_milestone: Stabilization after multiple non-wound hospital readmissions
clinical_barriers: Intermittent hospital readmissions for non-wound comorbidities
Cognitive impairment/Inability to make independent decisions

environmental_logic.physical_barriers: Patient moving to boyfriend's residence; caretaker (daughter) not living in-home
bureaucratic_steps: Director of Nursing (DON) vetting via Traditional Provider (TP) introduction

timeline_deltas.context: SW was unresponsive for 3 weeks; PN had to shadow TP to force face-to-face interaction.
Admitted to hospital 'here and there' during SNF stay for non-wound reasons, delaying trajectory.
Insurance played a role in the timing of the final 12/8 discharge date.

reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Shadowed Traditional Provider (TP) on clinical rounds
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Gained face-to-face access to DON and established trust/credibility.
Secured discharge plan and home health acceptance.
Maintained case continuity despite clinical volatility.

rank_1_best_practices.action: Physical shadowing of internal company providers (TP) to bypass administrative barriers
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Leveraging existing clinical relationships increases trust and bypasses the 'random caller' filter.

rank_0_boundary_failures.context: Assessing caregiver labor burden (turning/positioning) for sacral wounds
rank_0_boundary_failures.error_type: Passive / Clinical Boundary (Deemed outside PN role)

unscripted_chaos_signals: Non-live-in caregiver for high-needs sacral wound
